intro: Endotropis standleyana, commonly known as the standley's endotropis, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories.
